name: natriuretic peptide C

kegg.name: Vascular smooth muscle contraction - Homo sapiens (human)
Fluid shear stress and atherosclerosis - Homo sapiens (human)

summary: This gene encodes a preproprotein that is proteolytically processed to generate multiple protein products. These products include the cardiac natriuretic peptides CNP-53, CNP-29 and CNP-22, which belong to the natriuretic family of peptides. The encoded peptides exhibit vasorelaxation activity in laboratory animals and elevated levels of CNP-22 have been observed in the plasma of chronic heart failure patients. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2015].
